com.communote.server.widgets.springmvc

Class SpringFormWidget<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.widgets.AbstractWidget
      • com.communote.server.widgets.FormWidget
        • com.communote.server.widgets.springmvc.SpringFormWidget<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Widget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UserProfileChangePasswordWidget

    public abstract class SpringFormWidget<T>
extends FormWidget
    FormWidget that supports data binding and validation as done by spring's form controllers.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • createBinder

        protected org.springframework.web.bind.ServletRequestDataBinder createBinder(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                             T formBackingObject)
        Create a binder for the given request and form backing object. The name of the target object will be
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        formBackingObject - the backing object
        Returns:
        the prepared binder

      • formBackingObject

        protected abstract T formBackingObject(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Create the form backing object. The returned object can be a pre-initialized or empty object. In case an empty one is returned it can be filled later within prepareBackingObjectOnRefresh(HttpServletRequest, Object) or prepareBackingObjectOnSubmit(HttpServletRequest, Object).
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        Returns:
        the backing object

      • handleRefresh

        public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView handleRefresh()
        Description copied from class: FormWidget
        Handle a refresh
        Specified by:
        handleRefresh in class FormWidget
        Returns:
        the result to be passed to the view for rendering

      • handleSubmit

        public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView handleSubmit()
        Description copied from class: FormWidget
        Handle a submit
        Specified by:
        handleSubmit in class FormWidget
        Returns:
        the result to be passed to the view for rendering

      • initBinder

        protected void initBinder(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                          org.springframework.web.bind.ServletRequestDataBinder binder)
        Called by #createBinder(HttpServletRequest, T) to init the binder. This allows registering custom editors for certain fields of the backing object class.
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        binder - the binder
        See Also:
        DataBinder.registerCustomEditor(java.lang.Class<?>, java.beans.PropertyEditor)

      • onSubmit

        protected abstract void onSubmit(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                 T formBackingObject,
                                 org.springframework.validation.BindingResult errors)
        Do the actual submit operation, like updating database values. This method is only called if the validation did not find any errors.
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        formBackingObject - the form backing object
        errors - for adding errors that occur during the submit operation

      • prepareBackingObjectOnRefresh

        protected void prepareBackingObjectOnRefresh(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                             T formBackingObject)
        Called when the form widget is refreshing to allow initialization of the backing object if not already done in formBackingObject(HttpServletRequest). The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        formBackingObject - the backing object

      • prepareBackingObjectOnSubmit

        protected void prepareBackingObjectOnSubmit(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                            T formBackingObject)
        Called during submit of a form widget after the binder applied the request parameters to the backing object, but before calling the validator. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        formBackingObject - the backing object

      • processFormSubmission

        protected void processFormSubmission(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                     T formBackingObject,
                                     org.springframework.validation.BindingResult errors)

      • setValidator

        public void setValidator(org.springframework.validation.Validator validator)
        Set the validator to validate the submitted form backing object.
        Parameters:
        validator - the validator to use. If null no validation will be done.

      • suppressValidation

        protected boolean suppressValidation(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                     T formBackingObject)
        Whether to suppress validation for the current submit
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        formBackingObject - the backing object that will be validated
        Returns:
        false

      • validateForm

        protected void validateForm(T formBackingObject,
                            org.springframework.validation.BindingResult errors)
